reviewText: In this set we see the second pair of the Akatsuki, Hidan and Kakuzu, hunting for the tailed beasts. Also, Azuma and his team engage in battle against them. It's 12 episodes from 66-77.
When i found out that this was not what i wanted, i sent it back and never got a refund.
Naruto Shippuden continues to amaze me and this box set proves it.  I recommended this product to all fans of Naruto and Naruto Shippuden.  Many surprises accompany this box set just like the others.
My daughter loves these types of shows.  She will watch them as soon as they come in the mail, but she won't allow me to watch them without her.
Better then Box Set 5, this gets back to the main story after the arc, but as is becoming typical of these box sets leaves you hanging on a climatic edge.

This is one of more dramatic arcs in the Naruto series.  While Hidan does not use the type of language that the subbed versions does, it is still good.  The next set will be better because of Shikamaru and Naruto really show off their powers.

First things first i am huge naruto fan. I have seen all 220 episodes of naruto and 140 episodes of shippuden. This boxset contains episodes 64to77. Episodes 64 to 71 conclude the sora filler arc of the previous boxset. From 72 to episode 90 of shippuden contains the immortals arc. For those who don't know this is NOT a filler arc. This arc in my opinion is the greatest arc i have ever seen. This arc centers around the 2 akatuski members Hidan and kakuza. The immortals arc is brillant, unfortunatly this boxset finishes just as a major fight is about to begin. From episode 72 onwards shippuden is amazing and finally is as good as the original epiosodes of naruto. The only reason this gets a 4 is because only 5 episodes are originaly from masashi kashimotos manga. However you must watch these episodes to have a understanding of what happens in the next AMAZING boxset.

I love the series, but it sucks that we have to wait 3 months till the next box set comes out. Kind of wish they went back to bringing out one new one each month. Thats the only reason i cant give it 5 stars

"Box Set 6" contains episodes 66 - 77, continuing and concluding what was started in the previous season box, shippuden's first filler story known as the Sora Arc. Midway however it goes back to the original canon material with one of the more solid stories in the whole Naruto franchise. If you are looking into this box set you are already knowledgeable in the Naruto story and this set episodes do not disappoint. The previous box, in my honest opinion is better appreciated as a set-up to the characters that will be promptly featured in this canon arc.

By now you already know the standards for these box sets, dual language (English & Japanese), text-less Opening/Closing credits, Trailers and a behind the scene of the English production from Viz. I highly recommend this set, things are just starting to get good and it'll leave you wanting the seventh box which will continue the excellent story that just started in this one.

Overall I give this product an "okay" rating. Now this isn't because of price or the fact it is filler episodes. What really lowered this rating was the state in which the product arrived in. If I didn't know better I would have said it was a used instead of a new product. To start the cover surrounding the DVD box was dented with minor indents. Also many of the inside tabs keeping the disks in place broke leading to 2 out of 3 of the disks having slight scratches. Thankfully all the episodes played.

With all this in mind I do not believe Amazon.com was at fault since the shipment went MIA (missing in action) for almost a week due to a carrier mistake. I have a feeling this is how the item arrive a little worse for wear.

Amazing series. Naruto conveys the philosophical struggles many of us struggle with in life. Peace vs War, Love vs Hate... What do you consider to be true strength anyway? Compassion? Power? Naruto brings us all this and more in an action packed series kids will love. I suggest not watching the shippuden episodes until you are 13+... but I'm not a stickler for ratings. Introverts and extroverts, children and adults, boys and girls... All will find someone in the show they can relate to. 5 stars.

Great story. I love when anime progress stories like this. The original naruto series was well written. Each character was interesting. Alot of touching moments. Especially naruto,always trying to inspire an help. This continues in Shippuden. EXcept,the characters aged a few years. Which is what I meant by progression. Im not going to explain what each set is about. Just know this series is addictive. So if you get the chance,buy alot or all sets at once. I got all 15 on sale almost half off. 20ish$$$ a set. Im a little disappointed in the length of time it took to ship from Amazon LLC.5 business days just to be shipped. But arrived shortly after. The sets are kinda a ripoff considering each set is 11-13 episodes. But on sale it was a must buy. For 330$ I got 15 sets instead of paying
660$.I love this show and will keep buying. Set 16 is due to release in october 2013.

This box has the last couple episodes of the Sora arch, but then goes back to the Akatsuki main story line. I would have liked to see more about the other Jinchuriki being captured and more extended battle scenes on this topic - a more in depth encounter with Yugito for example. The Akatsuki are all pretty wild villians and its my belief that stylish and awesome power wielding bad guys is what makes anime great. Hidan is pretty radical for a bad guy and his power is far out. His "religion" is wild. I dig him as a villain. He continues his attack on Asuma in the next box set.
